description: This Waka onna mask was carved out of cypress by Yamaguchi Bidou, one of the few craftsmen in Japan today producing such masks in the traditional manner. It includes distinctive features: a large forehead; downcast, elongated eyes; a small mouth with a protruding lower lip; blackened teeth; and a white complexion. The young woman's expression is kept neutral so that the Noh performer’s gestures can project various emotions.
title: Waka Onna (Young Woman) Noh mask
